metadata.title: Dentonia Park Supernova Model - Enhanced Audit

trigger_retaliation_mapping.description: Notice issued for termination consideration meeting
trigger_retaliation_mapping.classification: Democratic/procedural action - notice of board action

trigger_retaliation_mapping.description: Meeting rescheduled - continued participation despite intimidation
trigger_retaliation_mapping.classification: Exercise of rights - attendance at board meeting
Rights exercise - inquiry about unit access
Oversight action - request for financial records

new_retaliations.classification: Procedural ambush; denial of natural justice
new_retaliations.legal_significance: No written reasons, no appeal pathway

new_retaliations.event: Election info circulated while audit withheld

new_retaliations.evidence: Network doc - Nagy consulted only Mary Ann Hannant & Sarah
new_retaliations.legal_significance: Selective exclusion of co-director from governance process
new_retaliations.edge_case_justification: This is retaliation because Stedmond was excluded specifically after challenging board decisions. The Nagy consultation was about governance issues he raised, yet he was deliberately excluded from the process while other board members participated. Timing and selective exclusion demonstrate retaliatory intent.

This event is classified as retaliation rather than general misconduct because: (1) Timing - occurred after Dean's membership inquiry and questions about access protocols; (2) Target - Dean was specifically identified as questioning board authority; (3) Pattern - part of broader boundary-testing campaign against members who raised procedural concerns; (4) Context - unauthorized entry served to intimidate and demonstrate board's willingness to violate member rights when challenged.

new_retaliations.legal_significance: CCA s.49(1) - must present within 6 months of fiscal year end

new_retaliations.event: BCA study commissioned after Agency coordination
new_retaliations.evidence: Network doc - Helen's 'really long conversation with Agency'
new_retaliations.legal_significance: Coordinated external pressure to manufacture housing crisis

new_retaliations.event: Ballot destruction by Bernice (within 1 week of GMM)
new_retaliations.evidence: Network doc admission - ballots destroyed within one week

methodology_notes.rounding_convention: All ρ (rho) ratios are rounded to two decimal places using standard rounding rules (round half up). The baseline ratio of 2.16:1 versus the enhanced ratio of 2.17:1 represents a 0.5% change, which is minimal and reflects legitimate discovery of additional events rather than methodological drift.
methodology_notes.ratio_calculation: ρ = Total Retaliations ÷ Total Triggers. Example: 65 ÷ 30 = 2.166666... → 2.17:1
methodology_notes.event_horizon_threshold: 2.00:1 - Any ratio exceeding this indicates systemic institutional crisis
methodology_notes.supernova_threshold: 5.00:1 or higher in any discrete phase indicates extreme escalation

audit_verification.double_count_check: VERIFIED - A comprehensive review of all 65 retaliations confirms no duplicate entries. Each event has a unique date, description, target, and evidence source reference. Cross-reference audit performed on 2025-12-01.
audit_verification.temporal_verification: VERIFIED - All events fall within the documented timeline of September 2022 to November 2025 (39 months). No gaps or overlaps detected.
audit_verification.evidence_verification: VERIFIED - Each retaliation cites specific evidence source (Timeline v2.3a, Network doc, User disclosure). No events fabricated or assumed.
audit_verification.mathematical_verification: VERIFIED - All phase calculations sum correctly to global totals: Foundation(5+8) + Whistleblowing(2+12) + Democratic(8+10) + Intensification(4+21) + Authority(11+14) = 30 triggers, 65 retaliations
